duties_responsibilities.duty: Performs skilled repairs on gasoline and diesel motor equipment including automobiles, trucks, and construction equipment.
Runs computerized diagnostic tests on vehicles and compares results with specifications for vehicle make to determine servicing and repair needs.
Performs and directs routine preventive maintenance servicing and inspections.
Grinds valves and fits new bearings, pistons, and rings.
Performs field repairs on equipment and operates the same.
Repairs or overhauls brake systems, differentials, transmissions, front and rear axles, and clutches.
Adjusts steering mechanisms and aligns wheels.
Occasionally operates machine shop equipment, including grinders, drill presses, and other metalworking machines to make and repair parts for automotive equipment.
Makes estimates and prepares requisitions for materials.
Inspects, repairs, and replaces automotive electrical system components.
Participates in snow and ice control activities.
May perform body repair and body painting tasks.
May supervise the repair and maintenance work of the second shift.

education_certification.credential: Associate’s degree in Automotive Mechanics, Automotive Technology, or related field (or equivalent experience)
